content: Can you name a culture whose writing system consists of consonant-vowel pairs where the vowels are indicated by diacritics or marks added above or below the consonants? This system is known as an abugida and is used by several cultures around the world. Can you think of one?

Certainly! The writing system used by the Devanagari script is an example of an abugida. Devanagari is used for several languages in India, including Hindi, Marathi, and Sanskrit. In this script, each consonant has an inherent vowel sound that can be modified or muted with the use of diacritics, which are marks added above, below, or next to the consonant.
